name: Cinnamomum

Female: Menses EARLY, PROFUSE, PROLONGED, BRIGHT RED
Uterine Hemorrhages caused by over-lifting, during puerperal state; menorrhagia

details: Cancer where pain and fetor are present. Bets when skin is intact. Its use in Hemorrhages has abundant clinical verification. Nosebleed. Hemorrhages from bowels, hemoptysis, etc. A strain in loins or false step brings on a profuse flow of bright blood. POSTPARTUM HEMORRHAGE. Flatulency and diarrhoea. Feeble patients with languid circulation.
dosage: Tincture to third potency. For cancer, strong decoction, one-half pint a day. OIL OF CINNAMON in aqueous solution best local disinfectant. 3-4 drops in two quarts of water as a douche, wherever a germicide and disinfectant is needed. Three drops on sugar for hiccough.
